body:
### Describe the bug

About 30% of the time when initializing `rust_analyzer` when using `nvim-lspconfig`, neovim segfaults, crashing and leaving an exit code of 139.

I have a discussion going here with the good authors of `rust_analyzer`: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-analyzer/issues/14050

They report that `nvim-lspconfig` is making incorrect requests to `rust_analyzer` on startup - this is not the fault of neovim, and I'll open an issue in that repo later. However, neovim shouldn't segfault when that happens. 

Relevant info:

in `/var/log/syslog` there are a number of these:

```
Jan 29 11:30:40 dellbert kernel: [521432.461742] nvim[245283]: segfault at 7fe1737a9ba2 ip 0000561a3b032117 sp 00007ffc01bd6078 error 4 in nvim[561a3ad4f000+349000]
```


### Steps to reproduce

First, have this minimal config.lua:

```lua
-- https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim
local lazypath = vim.fn.stdpath("data") .. "/lazy/lazy.nvim"
if not vim.loop.fs_stat(lazypath) then
  vim.fn.system({
    "git",
    "clone",
    "--filter=blob:none",
    "--single-branch",
    "https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim.git",
    lazypath,
  })
end
vim.opt.runtimepath:prepend(lazypath)

require("lazy").setup({
  {
    'williamboman/mason.nvim',
    config = {}
  },

  {
    'williamboman/mason-lspconfig.nvim',
    config = {
      ensure_installed = { 'rust_analyzer' }
    },
    init = function()
      require('mason-lspconfig').setup_handlers {
        ["rust_analyzer"] = function()
          require("lspconfig")["rust_analyzer"].setup({}) -- without this single line, nvim won't segfault
        end,

      }
    end
  },

  {
    'neovim/nvim-lspconfig',
  },
})
```

`nvim <somefile>` will crash every third time or so.

I'm doing this: `while [[ $? == 0 ]]; do vim README.md -c q; done` in any folder with a readme to open and close nvim a bunch of times real quick until it crashes, which it will quickly when initializing `rust_analyzer`.

### Expected behavior

Even if I or `mason` or `nvim-lspconfig` or `rust_analyzer` is doing something wrong, nvim shouldn't segfault. Something else should happen, like a message about `rust_analyzer` not opening correctly or something.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.9.0-dev-613+gef18c9f9b Build type: RelWithDebInfo LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3 Compilation: /usr/bin/cc -U_FORTIFY_SOURCE -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=1 -DNVIM_TS_HAS_SET_MATCH_LIMIT -DNVIM_TS_HAS_SET_ALLOCATOR -O2 -g -Og -g -Wall -Wextra -pedantic -Wno-unused-parameter -Wstrict-prototypes -std=gnu99 -Wshadow -Wconversion -Wdouble-promotion -Wmissing-noreturn -Wmissing-format-attribute -Wmissing-prototypes -Wimplicit-fallthrough -Wvla -fstack-protector-strong -fno-common -fdiagnostics-color=always -DINCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS -D_GNU_SOURCE -DNVIM_MSGPACK_HAS_FLOAT32 -DNVIM_UNIBI_HAS_VAR_FROM -DMIN_LOG_LEVEL=3 -I/build/nvim/parts/nvim/build/build/cmake.config -I/build/nvim/parts/nvim/build/src -I/build/nvim/parts/nvim/build/.deps/usr/include -I/usr/include -I/build/nvim/parts/nvim/build/build/src/nvim/auto -I/build/nvim/parts/nvim/build/build/include Compiled by root@lcy02-amd64-005  Features: +acl +iconv +tui

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A -- vim can't do these things

### Operating system/version

Linux dellbert 5.15.0-58-generic #64-Ubuntu SMP Thu Jan 5 11:43:13 UTC 2023 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Terminal name/version

Guake Terminal: 3.8.5 VTE: 0.68.0 VTE runtime: 0.68.0 Gtk: 3.24.33

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

snap

comment_data.body:
> NVIM v0.9.0-dev-613+gef18c9f9b

This commit is a month old. Can you try a later commit?

I have installed the latest version from the ubuntu snap store. The apt repository only has 0.6.x. The [release page](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/) only seems to have up to 0.8.3. I guess I can attempt to build it myself..

Ok I installed all the deps, downloaded the repo, built the project and installed it. Now I have:

```
/usr/local/bin/nvim --version
NVIM v0.9.0-dev-869+g964ae205a
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3
Compilation: /usr/bin/cc -Wall -Wextra -pedantic -Wno-unused-parameter -Wstrict-prototypes -std=gnu99 -Wshadow -Wconversion -Wdouble-promotion -Wmissing-noreturn -Wmissing-format-attribute -Wmissing-prototypes -Wimplicit-fallthrough -Wvla -fno-common -fdiagnostics-color=always -fstack-protector-strong -DNVIM_MSGPACK_HAS_FLOAT32 -DNVIM_TS_HAS_SET_MATCH_LIMIT -DNVIM_TS_HAS_SET_ALLOCATOR -DINCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS -D_GNU_SOURCE -DMIN_LOG_LEVEL=3 -DNVIM_UNIBI_HAS_VAR_FROM -I/home/aaron/Desktop/neovim/.deps/usr/include/luajit-2.1 -I/usr/include -I/home/aaron/Desktop/neovim/.deps/usr/include -I/home/aaron/Desktop/neovim/.deps/usr/include -I/home/aaron/Desktop/neovim/.deps/usr/include -I/home/aaron/Desktop/neovim/.deps/usr/include -I/home/aaron/Desktop/neovim/build/src/nvim/auto -I/home/aaron/Desktop/neovim/build/include -I/home/aaron/Desktop/neovim/build/cmake.config -I/home/aaron/Desktop/neovim/src -I/home/aaron/Desktop/neovim/.deps/usr/include -I/home/aaron/Desktop/neovim/.deps/usr/include -I/home/aaron/Desktop/neovim/.deps/usr/include
Compiled by aaron@dellbert

Features: +acl +tui
```

And I'm still seeing the same issues. The first two out of three times I tried to open it I got the segfault.

It looks like it's a different feature set in this version.. I read the suggested `:help feature-compile`, which states that `Nvim always includes ALL features..` so I don't understand that, but whatever, it doesn't seem to be making much of a difference.

I'm in over my head here, just trying to figure out why my neovim keeps crashing. It crashes no matter what I open it for, git commit messages, editing code, writing a journal entry, whatever. It's a real thorn in my side when I'm working with Rust code. (If I'm not on a rust project I comment out that line in my config). 

The first issue I created was in the `rust_analyzer` repo - those guys pointed out that neovim was sending an incorrect request to their lsp server. So I [left a ticket](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/issues/2431) in `nvim-lspconfig`. I'll admit I wasn't stoked when the ticket received a cursory closing without more than one line of explanation or seeming to have actually read the ticket.. but there were [two words](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/issues/2431#issuecomment-1416499193) that did actually shed some light, assuming they were in good faith: `can't reproduce`. They more applied to the contents of this ticket than that, which is not a duplicate of this ticket, but it at least means that it might be something specific to my system.

Maybe there's a way to further track down what's going on that I'm not aware of? Some log file or something that might point to a culprit? Maybe it's something specific about my system? Something that affects neovim when it calls `setup()` on the `rust_analyzer` specifically that lies outside of the config file system?

Ok that's cool, I installed that and retriggered the issue and got this:

```
           PID: 168741 (nvim)
           UID: 1000 (aaron)
           GID: 1000 (aaron)
        Signal: 11 (SEGV)
     Timestamp: Fri 2023-02-03 16:43:10 PST (52s ago)
  Command Line: /usr/local/bin/nvim --embed
    Executable: /usr/local/bin/nvim
 Control Group: /user.slice/user-1000.slice/user@1000.service/app.slice/vte-spawn-5752565b-d14a-4f4c-b84f-6544fe2ed5fd.scope
          Unit: user@1000.service
     User Unit: vte-spawn-5752565b-d14a-4f4c-b84f-6544fe2ed5fd.scope
         Slice: user-1000.slice
     Owner UID: 1000 (aaron)
       Boot ID: 37e0e176526d450b90f9d4616c362987
    Machine ID: 746dce727b0d40fdb1a76c02e5ba6847
      Hostname: dellbert
       Storage: /var/lib/systemd/coredump/core.nvim.1000.37e0e176526d450b90f9d4616c362987.168741.1675471390000000.zst (present)
     Disk Size: 1.6M
       Message: Process 168741 (nvim) of user 1000 dumped core.
                
                Found module linux-vdso.so.1 with build-id: dba798e3849739247caa8c4b4acc15cf5f1b3c88
                Found module ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 with build-id: 61ef896a699bb1c2e4e231642b2e1688b2f1a61e
                Found module libc.so.6 with build-id: 69389d485a9793dbe873f0ea2c93e02efaa9aa3d

                #0  0x00007f51e081cd30 __memcpy_avx_unaligned_erms (libc.so.6 + 0x1a0d30)
                #1  0x0000555be376520b lj_str_alloc (nvim + 0x35120b)

                #29 0x0000555be34a2b43 do_user_initialization (nvim + 0x8eb43)

                #34 0x0000555be34a0875 _start (nvim + 0x8c875)
```

I can't make heads or tails of what's going on in there, except that it is coming from executing lua, but that's 18 steps back so maybe you can glean more from there?
Closing as I no longer face this issue

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

title: Segfault 30% of the time when initializing LSP server with incorrect requests
